Greetings to Malaysian King
articles.content:
Greetings to Malaysian King
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Malaysian King Tuanku Syed Sirajuddin Ibni Al-Marhum Tuanku Syed Putra Jamalullail, on August 30 on the occasion of the 47th national day of his county.
 Expressing belief that the good relations of the friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the bilateral interests, the message sincerely wished the prosperity and well-being to the friendly Malaysians.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Trinidad And Tobago
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Trinidad And Tobago
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to George Maxwell Richard, president of Trinidad and Tobago, on August 25 on the occasion of the 42nd anniversary of the Independence of Trinidad and Tobago.
 The message wished him success in his responsible work for progress and prosperity of the country and expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the mutual interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: DPRK Senior Officials Congratulate National Day of Malaysia
articles.content:
DPRK Senior Officials Congratulate National Day of Malaysia
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Datuk Seri Abdullah Ahmad Badawi, prime minister of Malaysia on the occasion of the 47th national day of Malaysia.
 Wholeheartedly wishing the prime minister greater success in his work for economic development and prosperity of the country, the message expressed the belief that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in different fields.    
 Meanwhile, Paek Nam Sun, minister of Foreign Affairs, sent a message of greetings to Datuk Seri Syed Hamid Albar, his counterpart of Malaysia, to express the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the mutual interests and wholeheartedly wish him greater success in his work.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Japanese Guest
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Japanese Guest
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from the president of the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism and his party on a visit to the DPRK.
 It was handed to an official concerned by President Kikuo Tashiro on August 3.
